entry.title: The Landfill Tax (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 1st April 2008, amend the Landfill Tax Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/1527) (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Mental Health Act 2007 (Commencement No. 5 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order is the fifth commencement order made under the Mental Health Act 2007 and brings into force on 30th April 2008 section 44 of that Act, which amends sections 135 and 136 of the 1983 Act in relation to places of safety.

title.div: The Transport of Animals (Cleansing and Disinfection) (Wales) (No 3) (Amendment) Order 2008 / Gorchymyn Cludo Anifeiliaid (Glanhau a Diheintio) (Cymru) (Rhif 3) (Diwygio) 2008

div.p: This Order amends the Transport of Animals (Cleansing and Disinfection) (Wales) (No 3) Order 2003 (SI 2003/1968) (W.213) so that —

Cyhoeddir y fersiwn hon o Gorchymyn Cludo Anifeiliaid (Glanhau a Diheintio) (Cymru) (Rhif 3) (Diwygio) 2008 o dan awdurdod a goruchwyliaeth Argraffydd Deddfau Seneddol y Frenhines a Rheolwr Gwasg Ei Mawrhydi. Fe'i paratowyd i adlewyrchu'r testun fel y'i gwnaed.

entry.title: The Limited Liability Partnerships (Filing Periods and Late Filing Penalties) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations apply revised penalties which limited liability partnerships must pay if they deliver their accounts and auditors’ reports late.

entry.title: The Childcare Act 2006 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2008
entry.summary: This is the fifth Commencement Order made under the Childcare Act 2006 (“the Act”). The first three Commencement Orders brought provisions of the Act into force in relation to England. The fourth Commencement Order brought provisions of the Act into force in relation to Wales.

entry.title: The Hydrocarbon Oil, Biofuels and Other Fuel Substitutes (Determination of Composition of a Substance and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations, apart from regulations 3 and 8(3) (which come into force on 9th April 2008), come into force on 1st April 2008. They-

entry.title: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 (Prescribed Police Stations) (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: Section 87(1) of the Sexual Offences Act 2003 provides that a sex offender who is subject to the notification requirements in Part 2 of that Act fulfils their requirements by attending any police station in their local police area which is prescribed for this purpose in regulations.

entry.title: The Motorways Traffic Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-enact the provisions of the Motorways Traffic Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1984 as amended and provide for the regulation of traffic using motorways where such roads can be used only by traffic of Classes I and II specified in Schedule 1 to the Roads (Northern Ireland) Order 1993.

entry.title: The Plastic Materials and Articles in Contact with Food (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Plastic Materials and Articles in Contact with Food (Scotland) (No. 2) Regulations 2006 and re enact those Regulations with changes.

entry.title: The Eggs and Chicks (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations, which only extend to Scotland, revoke and replace, with modifications, the Eggs (Marketing Standards) (Enforcement) (Scotland) Regulations 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Home Detention Curfew Licence (Prescribed Standard Conditions) (Scotland) Revocation Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order revokes the Home Detention Curfew Licence (Prescribed Standard Conditions) (Scotland) Order 2008 which prescribes standard conditions to be included in any licence issued in respect of long-term or short-term prisoners released on licence under section 3AA(1) of the Prisoners and Criminal Proceedings (Scotland) Act 1993.

entry.title: The Home Detention Curfew Licence (Amendment of Specified Days) (Scotland) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Home Detention Curfew Licence (Amendment of Specified Days) (Scotland) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order amends the period specified in section 3AA(3) of the Prisoners and Criminal Proceedings (Scotland) Act 1993.

entry.title: The Asylum Support (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: Regulation 2 amends regulation 10(2) of the 2000 Regulations by increasing the cash amounts payable, as a general rule, in respect of a person’s essential living needs. These changes take effect from the 14th April 2008 and on that date the Asylum Support (Amendment) Regulations 2007, which set out the amounts previously payable, are revoked.

entry.title: The Official Statistics (Scotland) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order specifies that wholly Scottish devolved statistics produced, or to be produced, by the persons listed in Schedule 1 are official statistics. “Scottish devolved statistics” is defined in section 66 of the Statistics and Registration Service Act 2007.

entry.title: The Home Detention Curfew Licence (Prescribed Standard Conditions) (Scotland) (No. 2) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order prescribes standard conditions for the purposes of section 12AA of the Prisoners and Criminal Proceedings (Scotland) Act 1993 (“the 1993 Act”).

entry.title: The Police and Justice Act 2006 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order brings into force those provisions of the Police and Justice Act 2006 set out in articles 2 and 3 on 1 April 2008.

entry.title: The Renewables Obligation (Scotland) Amendment Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order amends the Renewables Obligation (Scotland) Order 2007.

entry.title: The Optical Charges and Payments (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Health and Personal Social Services (Optical Charges and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 (“the principal Regulations”) which provide for payments to be made, by means of a voucher system, in respect of costs incurred by certain categories of persons in connection with the supply, replacement and repair of optical appliances.

entry.title: The Social Security (Jobcentre Plus Interviews for Partners) Amendment Regulations 2008
entry.summary: The Social Security (Jobcentre Plus Interviews for Partners) Regulations 2003 (“the Principal Regulations”) impose a requirement on the partners of claimants of certain benefits to take part in a work-focused interview (“an interview”) where the claimant has been continuously entitled to the benefit for at least 26 weeks and it has been awarded at a higher rate referable to his partner.

title.div: The Rice Products from the United States of America (Restriction on First Placing on the Market) (Wales) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Cynhyrchion Reis o Unol Daleithiau America (Cyfyngiad ar eu Rhoi Gyntaf ar y Farchnad) (Cymru) 2008

div.p: These Regulations implement in relation to Wales Commission Decision 2006/601/EC on emergency measures regarding non-authorised genetically modified organism “LL RICE 601” in rice products (OJ No. L244, 7.9.2006, p.27) as last amended by Commission Decision 2008/162/EC amending Decision 2006/601/EC on emergency measures regarding the non-authorised genetically modified organism “LL RICE 601” in rice products (OJ No. L52, 27.2.2008, p.25). They revoke and re-enact the Rice Products (Restriction on First Placing on the Market) (Wales) Regulations 2006 (S.I.2006/2923 (W.260).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn rhoi ar waith, o ran Cymru, Benderfyniad y Comisiwn 2006/601/EC ar fesurau argyfwng ynghylch yr organedd a addaswyd yn enetig nas awdurdodwyd “LL RICE 601” mewn cynhyrchion reis (OJ Rhif L244, 7.9.2006, t.27) fel y'i diwygiwyd ddiwethaf gan Benderfyniad y Comisiwn 2008/162/EC sy'n diwygio Penderfyniad 2006/601/EC sy'n ymwneud â mesurau argyfwng ynghylch yr organedd a addaswyd yn enetig nas awdurdodwyd “LL RICE 601” mewn cynhyrchion reis (OJ Rhif L52, 27.2.2008, t.25). Maent yn dirymu ac yn ail ddeddfu Rheoliadau Cynhyrchion Reis (Cyfyngiad ar eu Rhoi Gyntaf ar y Farchnad) (Cymru) 2006 (O.S.2006/2923 (Cy.260).
